author: Dan
title: James Harden will be forever haunted by the ghost of Wesley Johnson's ankles
summary: Let us now bow our heads in remembrance of Wesley Johnson's ankles, gunned down in their prime by the outlaw James Harden.

title: 'Javanka' faction falling apart as Hope Hicks, others quit W.H.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Klay Thompson wants the Warriors to run the table to finish the season
summary: The Warriors' longest winning streak of the season is 11 games after having runs of 12 and 14 games last season. The lack of a long unbeaten stint has been one of the oddities of the campaign for the defending champs given their immense talent. Guard Klay Thompson thinks Golden State has an extended run in the tank to finish off the season after slogging into the All-Star break with the worst record since Steve Kerr became coach in 2014. “We're really trying to win every game going into the playoffs. And it might be unrealistic, but it'd be nice to do that,” Thompson told reporters in Washington D.C. Wednesday. “We're right on Houston's heels. We got a very tight race right now. So we got to

author: DeltaBravo
title: Derrick Rose's NBA Future Is Officially in Jeopardy
summary: When video surfaced last week appearing to show Derrick Rose shooting by himself in an empty gym at Cleveland State University, the common reaction was one of sadness. With Thursday's deadline for free agents to be playoff eligible, the phone has yet to ring with anything approaching a significant offer, multiple league sources told Bleacher Report. "The injuries and lack of enthusiasm to play hurts him," a Western Conference executive told B/R. The first part is true; there's no doubt that Rose's injury history transformed a superlative talent seemingly destined to be a max player for life into a role player who agreed to a one-year deal for the veteran's minimum of $2.1 million to be a backup on LeBron James' Cavaliers.

author: nanook
title: Jordan Clarkson explains differences between Kobe Bryant's, LeBron James' leadership
summary: The Los Angeles Lakers acquired Jordan Clarkson in a draft-night trade in 2014, and after a slow start, became an impact player for the Lakers late in his rookie season. By his second season, the storyline in Lakerland wasn't about himself and L.A.'s other youngsters, but rather the retirement of team legend Kobe Bryant. Bryant mentioned throughout that 2015-16 season how he sought to teach Clarkson and other young players on the team "to play championship-style basketball." As many a Bryant teammate can attest, though, playing alongside the future Hall of Famer came with heavy doses of Bryant's trademark competitiveness and demanding nature. Clarkson is now a member of the Cleveland Cavaliers

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: What we learned in the Warriors 109-101 win over the Wizards
summary: The Warriors wanted to come back from the NBA's All-Star break playing some of their best basketball of the season, and four games into the “second half” of the campaign, it seems as if the Warriors are doing just that. Golden State is now 4-0 since the All-Stat break after beating the John Wallless Washington Wizards 109-101 Wednesday night in the nation's capital. Kevin Durant led the way with 32 points on 60 percent shooting, and the Warriors saw solid performances from Klay Thompson (despite a poor start shooting), Draymond Green, and Andre Iguodala. Golden State will play the Hawks in Atlanta on Friday. They'll then have the weekend and Monday off before playing the Nets on Tuesday in Oakland.

author: third_watch
title: The Sixers have Waived Trevor Booker
summary: According to Michael Scotto of the Athletic, the Sixers will waive Trevor Booker. Booker is being waived to make space on the roster for the impending addition Ersan Ilyasova. Booker was acquired on December 7th from the Brooklyn Nets is exchange for Jahlil Okafor, Nik Stauskas and a 2019 2nd round pick. Given the options, I'm fine with waiving Booker. Someone on an expiring had to go, and the Sixers already have Amir Johnson and Richaun Holmes as backup bigs. But in the grand scheme, all of this is ultimately a reflection of Bryan Colangelo's poor maneuvers. The Sixers essentially traded Okafor, Stauskas and a 2nd round pick for the ability to sign a bought-out Ersan Ilyasova. Aside from the

author: DeltaBravo
title: Whiteside says something changed during All-Star break. Here's what happened.
summary: Lots of Heat chatter on a Wednesday: ▪ With Hassan Whiteside not getting the minutes he believed he deserved, and the Heat dissatisfied at times with the uneven effort, it was clear — as recently as two weeks ago — that something needed to change with the Whiteside/Heat dynamic. Since the All-Star break, three things have changed for the better — one for everyone to see and two behind the scenes. What's visible to everyone is that the Whiteside on display in three games since the break has been generally what the Heat wants — a fully engaged player displaying effort, passion and alertness on defense, along with the usual volume rebounding and blocks. But here's what happened behind the scenes:

title: James Harden on the Houston Rockets' NBA title chances: 'This is the year'

author: DeltaBravo
title: Florida school shooting suspect fired at hurricane-proof window in attempt to set up perch: Official
summary: Florida school shooter Nikolas Cruz allegedly fired at a third-floor window of Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in an apparent attempt to set up a perch from where he could shoot students who were outside, an official briefed on the investigation told ABC News today. Cruz's gunshots couldn't break through the window because it's made of hurricane-proof glass, the official said. Robert Runcie, the Broward County Public Schools superintendent, said in an interview today with ABC News' Victor Oquendo that bullets were fired "through the window" on the third-floor of the freshman building.

title: Sources: Lakers rookie guard Josh Hart has small fracture in left hand

author: nanook
title: With buyout agreement, Lakers waive Brewer
summary: ESPN The Los Angeles Lakers have waived Corey Brewer after reaching a buyout agreement with the veteran swingman. The move allows Brewer, an 11-year veteran, to sign with a playoff team as a free agent. "It was a pleasure to have Corey on our team," Lakers general manager Rob Pelinka said in a statement. "Corey's professionalism and competitive mindset will leave a positive mark on the Lakers for a long time. We appreciate his time with the team and wish him the best of luck for the remainder of his career." A reunion with his former college coach Billy Donovan in Oklahoma City is a serious possibility, league sources told ESPN's Adrian Wojnarowski. Brewer will talk to other teams, but the Thunder

author: third_watch
title: Sources: Trevor Booker to sign with Pacers after release from 76ers

author: third_watch
title: Tesco and Booker shareholders give marriage blessing
summary: Tesco's 4 billion pound takeover of Booker was overwhelmingly backed by shareholders of both companies on Wednesday, clearing the final hurdles to the creation of a new powerhouse in Britain's 200 billion pounds-a-year food market. Investor approval, which followed the regulatory green light in December, means the cash and shares deal to combine Tesco, Britain's biggest retailer, with Booker, the country's largest wholesaler, is set to complete on March 5. The support is a personal victory for Tesco Chief Executive Dave Lewis, who stunned the market in January 2017 with an agreed deal with Booker that was originally valued at 3.7 billion pounds.

author: third_watch
title: Baynes' Physicality Proves Too Much for Howard, Hornets to Handle
summary: BOSTON - The Boston Celtics logged a season-high 134 points Wednesday night, shot a season-best 62.1 percent from the field and routed the red-hot Charlotte Hornets by 28 points at TD Garden. All while the Celtics were lighting up the scoreboard, Aron Baynes was quietly enjoying one of his most brilliant, under-the-radar performances of the season. As Boston's offensive stars were busy piling up the points, Baynes was busy bodying up against Dwight Howard - one of the most challenging one-on-one tasks a big man can face in the NBA. And his effort against the eight-time All-NBA center was nothing short of magnificent during the 134-106 route. Howard entered the night as the league's fourth-leading

author: DeltaBravo
title: NBA coaching rumors: Suns targeting David Fizdale, but will Lakers intervene?
summary: After the NBA saw no firings during the entirety of the 2016-17 season, three NBA head coaches (Earl Watson, David Fizdale and Jason Kidd) have already lost their jobs — and there might be more moves coming. With the league's coaching carousel set to go into full swing this summer, let's examine the landscape and see what changes might be on the horizon for a few franchises. Latest NBA coaching news, rumors — Phoenix is targeting former Memphis coach Dave Fizdale to replace interim coach Jay Triano, according to league sources. When Fizdale was the lead assistant to Eric Spoelstra in Miami during the LeBron Era, James Jones was on the Heat roster. Jones has been the Suns' vice president of basketball

title: Wade hits game-winner in Heat's 102-101 win over 76ers

title: NBA memo to owners on Mark Cuban fine warns against dangers of tanking
summary: NBA commissioner Adam Silver warned teams that his office will be monitoring closely any potential tanking efforts.

author: nanook
title: Even with Rockets emerging as contenders, Warriors still hold major championship advantage
summary: As if having two MVPs in their primes and starting four All-Stars isn't quite enough, the Warriors have something else the Rockets (and all of the other top contenders) can only dream of: They've won a title as presently constituted. Their championship blueprint works. The Warriors can draw on the fact that they have mastered what it takes to win, while everyone else will head into the playoffs trying to figure out on the fly what they need to do to hold up the Larry O'Brien Trophy in June. As Warrior players are the first to admit, returning their top nine players from their 2017 championship team gives them a leg up on the competition. "Does it matter that we've won a title with this group?

title: Sources: Lakers, forward Corey Brewer agree to contract buyout
summary: The Oklahoma City Thunder have emerged as a team with serious interest in Brewer, but he will speak to all interested teams after being placed on waivers.

author: DeltaBravo
title: 10 NBA Records That No One Seems to Be Able to Break
summary: There are certain NBA records that will stand the test of time. These are the 10 most unbreakable records in NBA history.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Heat's Dwyane Wade Hits Game-Winner vs. 76ers
summary: Miami Heat guard Dwyane Wade entered "Father Prime" mode late in Tuesday's contest against the Philadelphia 76ers at AmericanAirlines Arena. With under nine seconds remaining and the Heat trailing 101-100, Wade found himself matched against Philadelphia's Ben Simmons near the top of the key.  The three-time champion sunk a long two-pointer over Simmons' outstretched arm to give the hosts a one-point advantage with 5.9 seconds on the clock.  76ers guard JJ Redick missed an open three-pointer as time expired, and the Heat held on for the thrilling victory.

author: third_watch
title: Iman Shumpert makes statement on Instagram after a kid asked why he doesn't play
summary: Since having knee surgery in November, Iman Shumpert has played five minutes in one game on Jan. 23 with the Cavs before being traded to the Kings. On Tuesday, he posted a statement on his Instagram Story after a kid asked him why he doesn't play anymore. He reminded everyone that he has been dealing with an injury and said the only reason he has been out so long is because he kept returning too soon. “I LOVE TO HOOP,” Shumpert wrote. “Perception is everything nowadays. If I don't post in a jersey … they think I don't love the game.” But Shumpert has more going on in his life than the NBA. He has an adorable daughter, and he's going to be in a VH1 reality show with Teyana Taylor called Teyana

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: 13-year-old LeBron James Jr. led his team to a middle school title in front of his dad
summary: LeBron James' 13-year-old son, LeBron James Jr., still has another year before his high school career starts, but it's clear why some of the top basketball programs are already vying for his services. LeBron Jr. led his Old Trail middle school team to an ISL Tournament title last week with a 52-35 win over Gilmour Academy. Much of LeBron Jr.'s championship performance was in front of his dad who was in the stands to root him on. Just as the elder LeBron had pointed out, it's easy to come away impressed with LeBron Jr.'s passing ability. He's the kind of athlete who could dominate against smaller competition as a scorer, but he leans more towards playmaking and distributing. That's a quality we

author: DeltaBravo
title: Report: Kawhi Leonard to resume workouts with Spurs, eyes March return
summary: A week after Gregg Popovich told reporters that he doesn't expect Kawhi Leonard to play this season, the Spurs forward is reportedly resuming workouts with the team.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: With key matchups against playoff contenders looming, Heat getting reinforcements
summary: Erik Spoelstra finally had a decision to make about which of his 14 healthy players he would have to make inactive on Tuesday night against the Philadelphia 76ers. With Kelly Olynyk ending a six-game absence due to a shoulder strain, and Rodney McGruder active for the first time this season, Spoelstra had an easy choice for one with Dion Waiters out with season-ending ankle surgery. Jordan Mickey, who has played in only 18 games this season but only twice in the past 22 games, was the other inactive player. Spoelstra is now left with another ongoing decision - how to distribute minutes. “I want to be mindful and empathetic to each player and their ambition and how they all want to contribute

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Jarrett Jack starting to think about a split from Knicks
summary: Jarrett Jack's eye is starting to wander. When the Knicks' starting point guard came back from the All-Star break, he was devout in his belief in wanting to stay a Knick the rest of the season, even if his role was reduced. After owning the starting spot since the season's fourth game, Jack, 34, came back to a whole new world. He hasn't seen the court in three straight games. Jack may not have fully expected the startling transformation of his role. The Knicks prefer to stick with Jack as a mentor for their three 25-and-under point-guard lottery picks. And though Jack is leaning toward not making a fuss, he finally admitted he might explore “my possible options'' with Thursday's approaching waiver

title: NBA YoungBoy Ordered Held without Bail in GF Kidnapping Case
summary: NBA YoungBoy Judge Says Keep His Ass Locked Up In Girlfriend Assault Case 1 2/27/2018 7:17 AM PST NBA YoungBoy will be cooling off in jail for a while longer after his arrest for allegedly assaulting his girlfriend -- the judge just ordered him held without bail. The 18-year-old rapper's been transferred to Georgia's Ware County Jail -- where he got a new mug shot -- and faced the judge. TMZ broke the story ... YoungBoy was busted Saturday night in Tallahassee on a kidnapping warrant, related to the attack on his gf, Jania. Cops say hotel surveillance video shows him body slamming her and then dragging her -- allegedly against her will -- back into the room. Jania has said they were just playing

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Jayson Tatum Reveals Which Celtics Have Helped Him Most In His Rookie Season
summary: Jayson Tatum fell into a pretty great situation upon entering the NBA. Tatum was one of the few top prospects in the 2017 draft to avoid joining a rebuilding team. The Boston Celtics selected the Duke product with the No. 3 overall pick this past summer, and it's been all good for both sides since. The Celtics have sat atop the Eastern Conference standings for the bulk of the season, and Tatum has been one of the top rookies in the league throughout the campaign. While Tatum's talent alone has produced great results on the court, his personal success also is a product of being in a great spot. Boston has one of the best coaches in the NBA in Brad Stevens, as well as a great blend of experience

author: DeltaBravo
title: Five veterans to consider dropping as Fantasy Basketball playoffs loom
summary: We examine five players owned in more than 50 percent of Yahoo leagues that it might be time to cut based on their recent play.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Trump, Who Cited Bone Spurs To Avoid Military Service, Claims He Would Have Fought Off Parkland Shooter Without A Weapon
summary: WASHINGTON ― President Donald Trump on Monday suggested that he would have personally fought off the school shooter at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School even while not armed, despite the fact that he previously deferred military service due to bone spurs in his foot. “I really believe I’d run in there even if I didn’t have a weapon, and I think most of the people in this room would have done that too,” he said during a White House event with the nation’s governors.

summary: A teenage survivor of the Parkland, Florida school shootings has called for tourists to boycott spring break vacations in the state until gun control measures are enacted. “Let’s make a deal DO NOT come to Florida for spring break unless gun legislation is passed.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Warriors fans divided on the dirtiness of the Zaza Pachulia play
summary: OAKLAND – In our daily newsletter, we asked Warriors' fans to weigh in on whether they thought Russell Westrbook's claim that Zaza Pachulia intentionally tried to hurt him was valid or ridiculous. In the Warriors' 112-80 win over the Oklahoma City Thunder on Saturday, Pachulia fell on top of Westbrook's legs in the third quarter. After the game, Westbrook claimed that Pachulia was playing dirty. “Nobody touched me,” Westbrook said. “He fell over my leg. He tried to hurt me.” Pachulia rebuffed Westbrook's accusation, calling it “childish.” He seemed genuinely surprised that Westbrook would even claim such a thing. “I don't want to go back and forth on those kinds of things,” Pachulia said. “That's
